tooltip.col-ratio: The value of the collateral in comparison to the amount of debt. Needs to be above the minimum required to avoid liquidation.
tooltip.collateral-locked: The amount of collateral in this position
tooltip.current-multiple: The current multiple of the position. It shows the exposure to price changes compared to holding the collateral directly.
tooltip.funding-cost: The cost in percentage of the net value of your multiply position if you were to keep it open for 1 year, without a change in collateral prices. The formula for it is: Debt / Net Value * Variable annual fee.
tooltip.liquidation-price: The price of the collateral at which this position becomes vulnerable to liquidation.
tooltip.liquidity: The current available liquidity allowing increases of positions.
tooltip.net-usd-value: The current net value of the position based on the oracle price of the collateral in the position minus the debt.
tooltip.pnl: The current profit or loss percentage of your position, including incurred gas costs. For a more detailed look on the profit and loss, please check the position.
tooltip.protection: Indicates if any Protection feature has been set up for this position. If not, you can activate it on the Protection page by clicking the button.
tooltip.variable: The variable annual rate paid over the debt in this position. This can be changed by the governance body of the protocol.
tooltip.vault-debt: The amount of dai debt in this position

card.collateralization-ratio-calculated: Your collateralization ratio is calculated by: value of your collateral / Dai debt.
card.collateralization-ratio-description: The price used to calculate the value of your collateral is the price obtained from the Maker oracles. Your collateralization ratio needs to be above the minimum required at all times to not get liquidated.
card.collateralization-ratio-next-price: Collateralization ratio on the next price will be:
card.collateral-locked-amount: The total amount of collateral locked in your vault is:
card.collateral-locked-USD: The total value in dollars of the collateral in your vault is:
card.collateral-locked-oracles: We use the current price from the Maker oracles to calculate this value. The current market price of your collateral may differ from this price.

simulate.footnote1: *Past performance is not indicative of future results.

modal.para1: Your collateralization ratio is calculated by: value of your collateral / Dai debt. The minimum active col. ratio is the ratio under which no further debt can be generated, nor collateral withdrawn. This is separate from the liquidation ratio.
modal.para2: If a vault is under the min. active col. ratio, collateral can be deposit and debt paid back.
modal.para3: The min. active col. ratio price displayed is the price of the collateral at this ratio.

tooltip.vaultId: The Vault ID is a unique reference for your Maker Vault in Summer.fi.
tooltip.stabilityFee: The Maker Protocol collects a Stability Fee on Dai that is generated from Maker Vaults. It is a variable-rate fee that changes when Maker’s governing body votes on proposals put forth by Risk Teams.
tooltip.liquidationFee:
If your vault is liquidated, a liquidation penalty is added to your vault’s total outstanding debt in Dai, which results in more collateral being sold to cover the outstanding debt. This is done to incentivize vaults owners to avoid liquidation.
The size of the liquidation penalty is determined by the Liquidation Fee which is calculated based on the debt in the vault.
tooltip.min-collateral: This is also called the Liquidation Ratio. If the Vault reaches below the minimum collateralization level it is considered undercollateralized and is subject to liquidation. Your collateral will then be partially auctioned off to cover outstanding debt and liquidation fee.
tooltip.dust-limit: The Dust Limit specifies the minimum amount of DAI that can be minted for this type of Vault. This value is also called the "Debt Floor".

card.liquidation-price-description: The Liquidation Price specifies the collateral price where your vault is subject to liquidation. If you think your vault is too close to liquidation price you can change your multiply vault to have a higher collateralization ratio, you can add more collateral on your own, or you can pay back some of your Dai debt.
card.liquidation-price-description-AUTO: The Liquidation Price is the price at which a Vault becomes vulnerable to liquidation.
card.vault-protection-description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Felis, dictum est non quisque aenean ac velit adipiscing.
card.liquidation-percentage-below: That is {{percentageBelow}} below the current price
card.buying-power-description: This is how much DAI you can use to buy more collateral right now. Buying Power specifies the maximum of Dai you can buy more collateral with based on the current state of your position. It is calculated by taking the maximum DAI available to you, using it to purchase more collateral, and locking the collateral back into the vault.
card.current-price-description: This is the current price of your vault collateral supplied by the Maker price oracles. There is a one hour delay before the oracle price is made current in the Maker Protocol.
card.next-price-description:
Here you can see the next price that will go into effect in the Maker Protocol. Compare this with the Liquidation Price to see whether your vault will be liquidated on the next price update.
{{nextPrice}}
card.more-info-oracles: More information on Maker oracles can be found <0>here</0>
card.based-on-price: The current net value is calculated based on the market price of
card.based-on-price-lp: The current net value is calculated based on the oracle price of
card.market-price-unavailable: Market price temporally unavailable, please check later
card.formula: P&L = ((Net value + Cumulative withdrawals - Gas fees spent) - Cumulative deposits) / Cumulative  deposits
card.formula-note: Note: The values to calculate deposits, withdraws and Gas Fees takes the price of ETH or the Collateral at the time of the transaction. Gas fees are not taken into account for the PnL.
card.net-value-description:
The Net Value is calculated as the current value of the collateral in your vault minus the current debt.
Note: This will not be exactly equal to the amount you will receive if you close your vault to Dai. This is due to fees applied when swapping collateral to Dai. The Net Value is calculated using the market price for the collateral using 1Inch.
card.deposit-collateral-on-vault-under-debt-f: You cannot deposit to your vault while it is below the minimum debt required of {{debtFloor}}. To add more collateral, generate Dai to get above the minimum required. Learn more about the Minimum Vault Debt here <0>here</0>)
card.current-stop-loss-coll-ratio: The current Stop-Loss Collateral Ratio is:
card.stop-loss-coll-ratio-desc: The Stop-Loss Collateral Ratio is the trigger point for executing the Stop-Loss on this Vault based on the Collateral Ratio at the next OSM price. Should the next OSM price take the current Vault Collateralisation Ratio below the Stop-Loss Collateral Ratio, then the Vault will be automatically closed.
card.stop-loss-ltv-desc: The Stop-Loss Loan to Value (LTV) is the trigger point for executing the Stop-Loss for this vault based on it's LTV. If the Vault's LTV is equal to or higher than the Trigger LTV, then the stop-loss protection will execute and the vault will be automatically closed.
card.dynamic-stop-loss-price-desc: The dynamic stop-loss price is the current price at which this Vault will be closed based on the set Stop-Loss {{ratioParam}}. The reason this price is dynamic is that the Stop-Loss trigger is based on a {{ratioParam}}, so when the Vault is adjusted, or Stability Fees accrue, it automatically adjusts the price at which the Stop-Loss will trigger.
card.current-dynamic-stop-loss-price: The current Dynamic Stop-Loss Price is:
card.max-token-on-stop-loss-trigger-desc: The estimated {{token}} on Stop-Loss trigger is the approximate amount of {{token}} you can expect to get returned to the wallet when the Vault has been closed because of Stop-Loss. It is very difficult to give a perfect amount as it depends on several factors at the time of the Stop-Loss trigger, such as market price, available liquidity and gas costs. This calculation assumes a 2% difference from Trigger Price to Market Price. The amount saved compared to liquidation is based on the assumption of not paying a Liquidation Penalty, currently set to {{liquidationPenalty}}.

manage-earn-vault.earnings-to-date-modal: The earnings to date of the position. Calculated as the current net value of the position, minus the cumulative deposits, plus the cumulative withdrawals, and not accounting for the Summer.fi fees. The 'After fees' value is accounting for the earnings including the Summer.fi fee, and the Ethereum Gas fees.
manage-earn-vault.net-apy-modal: The annual percentage yield, accounting for fees.  Calculated as the percentage price increase of the {{ token }} token over the last 7 days, annualised, and subtracting the variable annual fee.
manage-earn-vault.net-apy-modal-aave: The annual percentage yield, accounting for fees. Calculated as the yield on the stETH token over the last 7 days, annualised, and subtracting the variable annual fee paid in Aave for the ETH.
manage-earn-vault.exposure-modal: The total exposure of the position, expressed as a multiple of the capital deployed.
manage-earn-vault.liquidation-price-ratio-modal-aave: The liquidation price ratio indicates to what price ratio stETH needs to drop in comparison to ETH in order to get liquidated on this position. If this comes within 5% it will be indicated as red, within 20% as orange, and above 20% as green. Liquidation results in a liquidation penalty. You can find the history of the ratio here: <0>Ratio history</0> <1/><1/> You can adjust your risk by using the adjust risk functionality.
manage-earn-vault.has-asset-already: There is an active Aave position open in this address. Therefore, you cannot open a stETH earn position. Close your Aave position first to continue.
manage-earn-vault.net-value-calculation: The current net value is calculated based on the oracle price of {{oraclePrice}} {{collateralSymbol}}/{{debtSymbol}}. This net value doesn't include the cost of the closing fee or the difference that might happen due to slippage or price changes once you close your position. Net value of position if closed will likely be lower.
manage-earn-vault.after-ltv-ratio-below-stop-loss-ltv: You cannot make adjustments to your position which take it above your Stop-Loss Loan to Value, please update or cancel your stop-loss if you want to make this adjustment.

liquidation-price.first-description-line-long: The Liquidation Price is the collateral price at which a position will be liquidated. This number is denominated in debt
liquidation-price.first-description-line-short: The Liquidation Price is the debt price at which a position will be liquidated. This number is denominated in collateral
liquidation-price.third-description-line: The liquidation penalty is the % that will be added to the debt as a penalty in case of liquidation.

ltv.first-description-line: Your Loan to Value ratio represents how much you have borrowed based on your collateral supplied
ltv.second-description-line: The Max Loan to Value (LTV) ratio defines the maximum amount that can be borrowed with your collateral
ltv.third-description-line: The liquidation threshold is the percentage at which a position is undercollateralised. If your LTV rises above the LT, the position is undercollateralised and could be liquidated.
ltv.fourth-description-line: The Stop loss Loan to Value indicates the Loan to value at which your position will be stop lossed. You can adjust this in the <0>protection tab</0>.
ltv.stop-loss-not-set: Not set - click to set up stop loss.

net-borrow-cost.supply-apy-note: (Please note that this is only the lending market APY, and any yield from the underlying tokens such as rETH, wstETH or sDAI is not taken into account)
net-borrow-cost.first-description-line: The cost to borrow is the percentage this position is paying on its net value, using the debt APY minus the APY for the collateral supplied.
net-borrow-cost.third-description-line: This value represent how much your debt will grow in one year. It's your current debt times the borrow rate. This amount is an estimate that changes with the changes in the rates. Your net value growth will be positive or negative in 1 year determined by your PNL, effective collateral growth due to interest and realized debt rate.
net-borrow-cost.positive-negative-line: If the values are positive you are paying to borrow, if negative you are paid to borrow.

aave.subheader1: A liquidation has happened on this Position.

above-max-ltv.header: This position is currently higher than the maximum loan to value and can only be reduced.
above-max-ltv.subheader: The current loan to value of {{loanToValue}} is higher than the maximum loan to value of {{maxLoanToValue}} allowed by the protocol. Therefore this position can only be de-risked. If the loan to value of the position reaches {{liquidationThreshold}} the position will be available for liquidation.

aave-multi-position.header: This position is affected by other assets on Aave
aave-multi-position.subheader: This position is not reflecting the entire position on Aave, as there are other assets put up as collateral or debt on this same DS-Proxy. Contact us to see what you can do.

setup-stop-loss.content: Reduce the risk of ruin with automated Stop-Loss. Cap your downside with the option to close to either Dai or {{token}} at your desired Price or Collateral level. Find out more about how it works
setup-stop-loss.content-generic: Reduce the risk of ruin with automated Stop-Loss. Cap your downside with the option to close to either collateral or debt token at your desired Price or Collateral level. Find out more about how it works

get-protection.content: Set up Stop-Loss protection or an Auto-Sell to protect your vault from liquidation if it drops below your chosen collateralization ratio.

what-are-the-risks.content: Find out about the underlying creation of the position, the risks, where your capital is at and more in the FAQ section.

history-coming-soon.description: We currently don't support {{protocol}} {{proxyVersion}} history on the {{network}}.

too-low-net-value-for-protection.header: You need to have a minimum of ${{netValue}} of net value in this position before you can set up Automated Protection
too-low-net-value-for-protection.description: Summer.fi Automated Protection allows you to set up a dynamic Stop-Loss or Auto-Sell Strategy on your position based on the Loan to Value. This can protect your position from liquidation or reduce your exposure to the collateral asset in the case of a sharp downturn in price. Learn more about how it works, here.

too-low-net-value-for-optimization.header: You need to have a minimum of ${{netValue}} of net value in this position before you can set up Automated Optimization
too-low-net-value-for-optimization.description: Summer.fi Optimization allows you to set up a dynamic Auto-Buy on your position based on the Loan to Value. This will increase your exposure to the collateral asset as the price changed. Learn more about how it works, here.

open-vault-two-tx-setup-requirement: You will be required to sign 2 transactions. 1 to setup the the {{type}} and another to set up the Stop-Loss.
open-vault-sl-second-status-not-started-: Transaction will start once 1/2 is completed
learn-more-at-oasis: Learn more at Summer.fi Knowledge Base

subtext.collateral: Deposit or withdraw from your Vault. Save gas by combining transactions.
subtext.dai: Generate DAI from the collateral in your vault, or pay back DAI. Save gas by combining transactions.
subtext.edit: Simulate your vault by configuring the amount of collateral to deposit, and DAI to generate.
subtext.edit-multiply: Simulate your vault by configuring the amount of collateral to deposit, and slide your multiply factor.
subtext.edit-multiply-dai: This vault can be created by simply <1>depositing DAI</1>. The transaction will create the {{token}} position for you based on this DAI deposit.
subtext.proxy: With your smart proxy multiple actions can be performed in one transaction for your Vault. Read more in the <1><2>Knowledge Base</2></1>

subtext.proxy-progress: Read more on smart proxy in the <1>Knowledge Base</1>.
subtext.allowance: Specify an allowance to set a maximum on the amount of tokens the vault contracts can interact with.
subtext.daiAllowance: Specify an allowance to set a maximum on the amount of tokens the vault contracts can interact with.
subtext.commonAllowance: Select a maximum allowance amount for your Smart DeFi Account. Your Smart Defi Account will be able to interact with up to: {{allowanceAmountInfo}}
subtext.confirm: This will update your vault to a multiply vault. It does not require a transaction. You will be able to switch it back to the Borrow view.
subtext.review-manage: Here you can review the details of the changes to your vault.
subtext.confirm-in-progress: Your Vault is currently being created.
subtext.modified: Your Vault is currently being updated. Please wait.
subtext.new-proxy-temporally-disabled: Proxy creation is temporary disabled around the merge, to prevent unexpected behavior from re-orgs. See our <1>blog</1> for more info.

oracles.description: Below the current and next prices of the collateral types that are accepted for Maker vaults can be viewed. Most use the Oracle Stability Module (OSM). This module updates the price just once every hour. Therefore, when a crash is happening, users still have an hour to react to the new price.

protection.set-downside-protection-desc: Set the {{ratioParam}} trigger at the point which you want your Vault to be closed at automatically. Learn more about how Stop-Loss works
protection.setting-downside-protection-desc: Your Vault is currently being updated to add Stop-Loss Protection. Your Vault will not be protected from Liquidation until this completes.
protection.cancelling-downside-protection-desc: The Stop-Loss cancellation is in progress. Once the transaction is done, the Stop-Loss will be removed.
protection.position-again-at-risk: Your position is then at risk of liquidation again once the liquidation price is hit.
protection.downside-protection-complete-desc: You have successfully setup Stop-Loss Protection on your Vault. Find out more about how Stop-Loss works
protection.cancel-protection-complete-desc: Stop-Loss has been cancelled successfully. You can always set up it again to protect your vault. Your position is now again at risk of liquidation once the liquidation price is hit.
protection.banner-content: Setup a dynamic Stop-Loss based on your Collateralisation Ratio to help protect your Vault from liquidation or the worry of big losses.
protection.zero-debt-heading: You need to Generate {{debtToken}} before you can set up Automated Protection
protection.zero-debt-description: Summer.fi Automated Protection allows you to set up a dynamic {{bannerStrategiesKey}} Strategy on your vault based on the {{ratioParamTranslationKey}}. This can protect your vault from liquidation or reduce your exposure to the collateral asset in the case of a sharp downturn in price. Learn more about how it works
protection.below-dust-limit-heading: You need to generate Dai above the minimum debt limit to set up Stop-Loss Protection
protection.not-guaranteed: Automation isn't guaranteed to work 100% of the time
protection.guarantee-factors: Several factor can relate to its success. These include liquidity, volatility and gas.
protection.learn-more-about-automation: Learn more about automation and how Summer.fi is building the best automation product on Ethereum →
protection.automation-fact: {{success}} of {{total}} Vaults using Automation have successfully been saved the last 90 days
protection.modal-description: You have the Stop-Loss protection enabled. Click on the banner below to see more details.

protection.stop-loss-triggered-desc: Your Stop-Loss was triggered on your Vault

protection.cancel-notice: Cancelling your Stop-Loss means you will no longer have protection in place and you will need to actively monitor your {{ratioParam}}.
protection.find-more-about-setting-stop-loss: Find out more about setting Stop-Loss →
protection.sl-triggered-gas-estimation: This fee represents the expected Gas Cost based on the current price of ETH and an assumed Gas Price of 50 GWEI.
protection.coll-ratio-close-to-current: Your Stop-Loss Trigger Col. Ratio is very close to your current Col. Ratio. Only continue if this is intended and understand your Vault could be closed with a small price change.
protection.closed-vault-existing-sl-header: Your vault is closed but stop-loss is still active
protection.closed-vault-existing-sl-description: You can cancel your existing stop-loss here or deposit into your vault in overview tab
protection.adding-new-triggers-disabled-description: Due to extreme adversarial market conditions we have currently disabled setting up NEW Stop-Loss triggers, as they might not result in the expected outcome for our users. Please use the 'close vault' option if you want to close your vault right now.

multiply.title: Summer.fi Multiply
multiply.description: Multiply your exposure to your favorite crypto assets. Browse our featured products or select a asset.

borrow.title: Summer.fi Borrow
borrow.description: Borrow Dai against your favorite crypto assets. Use the Dai however you like. Browse the featured, or select an asset to view our products.

earn.title: Summer.fi Earn
earn.description: Put your crypto assets to work today. Start generating the best yields. Select your Earn product below.

eth.description: ETH facilitates operations on the Ethereum network. It is used by network participants to execute their requested operations on it. We can think about it as the "fuel" of the network. You can maximize your ETH utility by Multiplying your exposure or Borrowing against your ETH.

btc.description: Bitcoin itself cannot be used directly, but needs to be moved onto the Ethereum Blockchain to use it in DeFi. Both wrapped Bitcoin (wbtc) and renBTC deliver the power of Bitcoin with the flexibility of an ERC20 token. Get the most of your Bitcoin Multiplying your exposure or Borrowing.

usdc.description: USDC is a 1:1 USD-backed centralized stablecoin, fully regulated. USDC is natively supported on multiple layer 1 blockchains including Ethereum as an ERC-20 token, Algorand as an ASA token, Solana as a SPL token, TRON as an TRC-20 token, and Stellar as a native asset. It is operated by Circle.

lp-token.description: Tokens deposited into a liquidity pool, automatically generates a new token that represents the share the depositor owns of that pool. This is called a liquidity provider (LP) token, and it can be used to borrow against. This has the effect of multiplying your liquidity share in the pool.

yfi.description: Yearn.finance (YFI) is the governance token of the Yearn.finance platform. The platform is a yield optimizer that moves funds around the decentralized finance ecosystem in an effort to generate a high return. Multiply your exposure to YFI, or borrow against it.

dai.description: Dai is the largest overcollateralized decentralized stablecoin. Dai can be generated on Summer.fi using various collateral types. Here we show the products that will net you returns in DAI.

uni.description: UNI is the governance token of Uniswap Protocol, which is governed by a decentralized community who propose and vote on upgrades to the protocol. Uniswap is a decentralized trading protocol for swapping ERC20 tokens.

link.description: Loopring is an Ethereum token that describes itself as “an open-sourced, audited, and non-custodial exchange protocol.” It aims to allow anyone to build non-custodial, order book-based exchanges on Ethereum by leveraging zero-knowledge proofs.

matic.description: Polygon (MATIC) is an Ethereum token that powers the Polygon Network, a scaling solution for Ethereum. Polygon is a protocol and a framework for building and connecting Ethereum-compatible blockchain networks. Aggregating scalable solutions on Ethereum supporting a multi-chain Ethereum ecosystem.

mana.description: MANA is the ERC-20 token built for Decentraland, a virtual reality platform powered by the ethereum blockchain. It is primarily used to buy goods, services and LAND (an NFT token) within Decentraland.

guni-slippage-overridden: Your custom slippage has been overridden for this vault. GUNI vaults can only be opened with a slippage at 0.1%.
temporary-guni-message: The max multiple for your GUNI position has been increased by Maker governance from 20x to 50x. To take advantage of this you will need to close this vault, and open a new GUNI position. Read more in

asset.label: Asset
asset.tooltip: The identifier of the position asset type, uses the protocols naming conventions.

position-id.label: Position ID
position-id.tooltip: The Position ID is used to reference the position across Summer.fi

collateral-ratio.label: Collateral Ratio
collateral-ratio.tooltip: The value of the collateral in comparison to the amount of debt. Needs to be above the minimum required to avoid liquidation.

dai-debt.label: Dai Debt
dai-debt.tooltip: The amount of dai debt in this position

collateral-locked.label: Collateral Locked
collateral-locked.tooltip: The amount of collateral in this position

variable-perc.label: Variable %
variable-perc.tooltip: The variable annual rate paid over the debt in this position. This can be changed by the governance body of the protocol.

protection.label: Protection
protection.tooltip: Indicates if a Stop-Loss Protection has been set up for this position. If not, you can activate it on the Protection page by clicking the button.

net-value.label: Net Value
net-value.tooltip: The current net value of the position based on the oracle price of the collateral in the position minus the debt.

multiple.label: Multiple
multiple.tooltip: The current multiple of the position. It shows the exposure to price changes compared to holding the collateral directly.

liquidation-price.label: Liquidation Price
liquidation-price.tooltip: The price of the collateral at which this position becomes vulnerable to liquidation.

borrow-cost.label: Borrow Cost
borrow-cost.tooltip: The cost in percentage of the net value of your multiply position if you were to keep it open for 1 year, without a change in collateral prices. The formula for it is: Debt / Net Value * Variable annual fee.

pnl.label: PnL
pnl.tooltip: The current profit or loss percentage of your position, including incurred gas costs. For a more detailed look on the profit and loss, please check the position.

seven-day-yield.label: 7 Day Yield
seven-day-yield.tooltip: The 7 day yield is the average returns of the past 7 days, annualized, and subtracts any variable rates that need to be paid.

liquidity.label: Liquidity
liquidity.tooltip: The current available liquidity allowing increases of positions.

collateral-deposited.modal-description: This is the amount of tokens you have as collateral for your debt.

position-debt.title: Position Debt
position-debt.modal-description: This is the total number of tokens you have borrowed plus any accrued interests.

available-to-withdraw.title: Available to Withdraw
available-to-withdraw.modal-description-lend: This the the amount of collateral you can withdraw taking into account the current max LTV and debt of the position.
available-to-withdraw.modal-description-supply: This the the amount of tokens you can withdraw that are not frozen in liquidation or being lent out.

available-to-borrow.title: Available to Borrow
available-to-borrow.modal-description: This the the amount of tokens you can borrow with your current collateral taking into account the current max LTV and debt.

net-value-modal.modal-description: The current net value is calculated based on the market price of ${{netValueTokenPrice}}
net-value-modal.modal-footnote-1: P&L = ((Net value + Cumulative withdrawals) - Cumulative deposits) / Cumulative deposits
net-value-modal.modal-footnote-2: Note: The values to calculate deposits, withdraws and Gas Fees takes the price of ETH or the Collateral at the time of the transaction. Gas fees are not taken into account for the PnL.

rewards.title: Claim rewards
rewards.modal-value-3: Total earned in the current period
rewards.modal-value-4: From this position in current period

landing-banner.title: Get exclusive Ajna tokens when you use Summer.fi
landing-banner.description: Summer.fi users are eligible for exclusive Ajna token rewards! Open an Ajna position through Summer.fi and automatically earn Ajna tokens.

liquidation-price.modal-description: The liquidation price represent the price at which it is expected that liquidators successfully action your collateral to repay your debt. Monitor this value compared to market price.

ltv.modal-description: Your Loan to Value ratio represents how much you have borrowed based on your collateral supplied.
ltv.modal-footnote-description: Ajna Max LTV changes with lenders and borrowers activities. Pay attention to not go over the max and risk being liquidated.

threshold-price.title: Threshold Price
threshold-price.modal-description-1: By taking the debt token amount and dividing it by the collateral token amount, the loan's threshold price, TP, can be calculated.
threshold-price.modal-description-2: Your loan will be eligible to be kicked into the liquidation queue if the pool's Lowest Utilization Price (LUP) is less than your Threshold price.
threshold-price.modal-subtitle: To avoid liquidation, always ensure your TP < LUP

content-card.modal-earn-description: The total amount of tokens available in position, this includes the earned amount.

borrow-rate.tooltip-description: Earned Ajna tokens: You have earned Ajna tokens from Summer.fi × Ajna token rewards.
borrow-rate.tooltip-description-non-owner: Earned Ajna tokens: {{address}} have earned Ajna tokens from Summer.fi × Ajna token rewards.
borrow-rate.modal-description: The borrow rate represents how much your debt will increase in one year at the current market utilization. This rate is variable, changing every 12 hours with utilization in the pool.
borrow-rate.modal-footnote-description: The borrow rate expressed in {{quoteToken}} amount over one year. The amount is an estimate that changes with the changes in the rates. Your effective cost will be determined by your P&L.

total-earnings.title: Total Earnings
total-earnings.modal-description: The amount of {{quoteToken}} you have earned since this position was opened. The total earnings you have made from this position excluding any gas costs are:
total-earnings.modal-footnote-description: Including gas costs, your net earnings on this pool are:

max-lending-ltv.title: Max Lending LTV
max-lending-ltv.modal-description: The max lending LTV represents the terms you are offering to borrowers. Your selected price divided the market price represents the maximum LTV you are allowing others to borrow against their collateral for your lent asset.

position-lending-price.title: Position Lending Price
position-lending-price.modal-description: The lending price is akin to a limit order, if the market price hits the selected price you will be left with collateral tokens. It's expected that borrowers are liquidated some time before your price is reached, and you will be able to withdraw funds in the token you deposited.
position-lending-price.modal-footnote-description-min: Below this lending price you will not earn any yield. Select a lending price above this level to earn.
position-lending-price.modal-footnote-description-max: Above this lending price you will not earn any yield. Select a lending price below this level to earn.

projected-annual-rewards.title: Annual Reward Rate
projected-annual-rewards.modal-description: This is the projected annual reward rate based on your earned rewards from the previous day and the current Ajna token price. The rewards and rate cannot be guaranteed and is likely to change as market conditions evolve. The current projected rate is:

total-ajna-rewards.title: Claim rewards
total-ajna-rewards.modal-description: You have earned Ajna tokens from Summer.fi x Ajna token rewards.
total-ajna-rewards.modal-value-3: Total earned in the current period
total-ajna-rewards.modal-value-4: From this position in current period

buying-power.tooltip: There is currently no debt drawed for this pool. Buying power can be calculated after any position draws debt for the first time.

title.risk: Things to know before opening an Ajna position
title.risk-oracless: This pool is offered with Ajna Permissionless UI, things to know:

risk.intro: Ajna is a new money market DeFi protocol. Benefiting from more competitive, market-driven parameters. A few things to note before opening a position:

borrow: Its a new DeFi protocol. <2><4>See Ajna Audits here</4></2>
There is an origination fee when borrowing to avoid rapid changes in rates.
Ajna has no oracles and a unique liquidation mechanism. <3><4>Read more on how Ajna works</4></3>
multiply: Its a new DeFi protocol. <2><4>See Ajna Audits here</4></2>
There is an origination fee when borrowing (or multiplying) to avoid rapid changes in rates.
Ajna has no oracles and a unique liquidation mechanism. <3><4>Read more on how Ajna works</4></3>
earn: Its a new DeFi protocol. <2><4>See Ajna Audits here</4></2>
Your position will lend only against one asset.
Failure to monitor and adjust your position may result in holding the collateral asset
Ajna has no oracles and a unique liquidation mechanism. <3><4>Read more on how Ajna works</4></3>
oracless: <5>Always do your own research and make sure you have selected the correct token contract address<5/>
This asset pair is supported with Ajna Permissionless UI, no price feed information will be available
Monitor your position closely and ensure you understand the risks before proceeding

being-liquidated.title: This position is currently being liquidated
being-liquidated.message: A penalty of 7% has been applied increasing to the total debt. Liquidators can bid on your collateral to pay back the debt. You can still adjust your position, by paying back debt or adding more collateral to remove it from the liquidation auction. <0>Read more about Ajna Liquidations →</0>

got-liquidated.title: This position got liquidated. You have collateral to withdraw
got-liquidated.message: The liquidation process is over you can now reclaim any collateral left. <0>Read more about Ajna Liquidations →</0>

You can withdraw deposited tokens or repay position's debt. We are working on a resolution. Further announcements will be made via <0>our discord →</0>

validations.deposit-amount-exceeds-collateral-balanc: You cannot deposit more collateral than the amount in your wallet.
validations.payback-amount-exceeds-debt-token-balanc: You cannot pay back more than the amount of debt token in your wallet.
validations.has-insufficient-eth-funds-for-tx: Your ETH balance is too low to pay for transaction.
validations.has-potential-insufficient-eth-funds-for: Your ETH balance is too low to pay for transaction.
validations.withdraw-undercollateralized: You cannot withdraw more than {{amount}} {{collateralToken}}, as this would make your position eligible for liquidation. Please enter a lower amount.
validations.borrow-undercollateralized: You cannot generate more than {{amount}} {{quoteToken}}, as this would make your position eligible for liquidation. Please enter a lower amount.
validations.earning-no-apy: You will be lending without earning any yield.
validations.withdraw-more-than-available: You cannot withdraw more than {{amount}} {{token}}. Please choose a lower amount.
validations.withdraw-not-available: You do not currently have any balance that is available for withdrawal. Please check back later.
validations.after-lup-index-bigger-than-htp-index-de: You cannot adjust this position as there is not enough available liquidity in the pool. Please wait for more available liquidity.
validations.after-lup-index-bigger-than-htp-index-wi: You cannot withdraw this amount as there is not enough available liquidity in the pool. Please withdraw a lower amount or wait for more available liquidity.
validations.debt-less-then-dust-limit: The minimum debt for a position in this pool is {{minDebtAmount}}. Please update the parameters of this action to ensure the position has debt above {{minDebtAmount}} or no debt
validations.debt-less-then-dust-limit-multiply: Minimum debt generated is below the pool minimum. Please increase your deposit size or increase the LTV (if available).
validations.repay-more-then-debt: You cannot repay more than the total debt amount {{amount}} {{quoteToken}}.
validations.not-enough-liquidity: You cannot generate more debt than available liquidity. Current liquidity for {{collateralToken}}/{{quoteToken}} is {{amount}} {{quoteToken}}.
validations.withdraw-close-to-max-ltv: Withdrawing {{amount}} {{collateralToken}}, would take your position close to the maximum LTV. To reduce your risk of liquidation, please enter a lower amount.
validations.generate-close-to-max-ltv: Generating {{amount}} {{quoteToken}} of debt, would take your position close to the maximum LTV. To reduce your risk of liquidation, please enter a lower amount.
validations.liquidation-price-close-to-market-price: Warning your Liquidation Price is close to Market price please check that your liquidation Price is not above Market price to avoid being liquidated with this action.
validations.is-being-liquidated: Your position is currently being liquidated. A penalty has been applied increasing your debt. You still can <1>Deposit Collateral</1> or <1>Repay your Debt</1> to remove it from the liquidation auction. <2>Read more about <1>Ajna Liquidations →</1></2>
validations.collateral-to-claim: There is collateral tokens for you to claim. These tokens don't earn any yield. <2>Read more about <1>Ajna Lending →</1></2>
validations.price-below-htp: Unutilized Liquidity: Lending at this price means you are not earning any yield. <1>A deposit fee of 8 hours interest applies to all deposits.</1> <2><1>Help me pick correctly →</1></2>
validations.price-between-htp-and-lup: Available Liquidity: Your deposit is earning yield but is not currently utilised by borrowers. <1>A deposit fee of 8 hours interest applies to all deposits</1> <2><1>Help me pick correctly →</1></2>
validations.price-above-lup: Active liquidity: You are actively lending and will earn a yield whenever there are loans above {{lup}} {{collateralToken}}/{{quoteToken}}. <2><1>Help me pick correctly →</1></2>
validations.safety-switch-on: Due to a technical issue we have currently disabled depositing tokens into empty Ajna positions, as they might not result in the expected outcome for our users. We are working on a resolution. Further announcements will be made via <0>our discord →</0>
